bug.short_desc: libvirt selinux deny on start of VM unable to start VMs
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Recent update have broken VMs from running.
Looks like maybe a systemd update caused this issue.
Tested on a machine without the systemd update 229-13.fc24 and it works as soon as I update it is broken.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
Up to date
How reproducible:
Everytime
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Via Virt Manager start a KVM libvirt VM 2. Fails with a error 3. Try with virtsh 4. Fails
Actual results:
virsh # create /etc/libvirt/qemu/centos7.0.xml error: Failed to create domain from /etc/libvirt/qemu/centos7.0.xml error: SELinux policy denies access.
Expected results:
VM starts
Additional info:
In logs:
Aug 24 17:09:23 wks537630 nm-dispatcher[3267]: req:1 'up' [vnet0]: start running ordered scripts... Aug 24 17:09:23 wks537630 systemd-machined[2244]: Failed to start machine scope: Access denied Aug 24 17:09:23 wks537630 libvirtd[898]: SELinux policy denies access. Aug 24 17:09:23 wks537630 virtlogd[2228]: End of file while reading data: Input/output error Aug 24 17:09:23 wks537630 virtlogd[2228]: Cannot open log file: '/var/log/libvirt/qemu/centos7.0.log': Device or resource busy Aug 24 17:09:23 wks537630 libvirtd[898]: Cannot open log file: '/var/log/libvirt/qemu/centos7.0.log': Device or resource busy Aug 24 17:09:23 wks537630 virtlogd[2228]: End of file while reading data: Input/output error Aug 24 17:09:23 wks537630 audit[898]: VIRT_CONTROL pid=898 uid=0 auid=4294967295 ses=4294967295 subj=system_u:system_r:virtd_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 msg='virt=kvm op=start reason=booted vm="centos7.0" uuid=807f3763-ab6b-46f8-804e-486d8de15437 vm-pid=-1 exe="/usr/sbin/libvirtd" hostname=? addr=? terminal=? res=failed'
